citation.article-title: Rubrimonas shengliensis sp. nov. and Polymorphum gilvum gen. nov., sp. nov., novel members of Alphaproteobacteria from crude oil contaminated saline soil

p.s: Description of Rubrimonas shengliensis sp. nov.
id="par0060">Rubrimonas shengliensis (sheng.li.en'sis, N.L. fem. Adj. shengliensis, of or belonging to Shengli Oilfield, where the type strain was isolated).
id="par0065">Cells are Gram-stain negative, aerobic, non-motile and oval (0.67–0.80 μm × 0.91–1.82 μm), undergo binary fission and occasionally form chains containing 3–4 cells.
The colonies of the strains are small, smooth, circular, convex and pink in color.
Growth occurs at 4–50 °C, pH 6.0–9.0 and 0–10% (w/v) NaCl.
Optimum growth occurs at 28 °C, pH 7.0 and 1% (w/v) NaCl.
Positive for catalase, hydrolysis of starch, nitrate reduction and gelatinase.

Negative for oxidase, V-P reaction, H2S production, hydrolysis of Tween 80, indole production, arginine dihydrolase, urease, PNPG, and the assimilation of malate, citrate, phenylacetate, adipate, caprate and gluconate.

Acid is not produced from l-arabinose, d-ribose, methyl-β-d-xylopyranoside, d-galactose, d-glucose, d-fructose, arbutine, d-lactose and xylitol, but not from glycerol, d,l-arabitol, meso-erythritol, d-adonitol, d-mannose, l-sorbose, dulcitol, inositol, d-mannitol, d-sorbitol, methyl α-d-mannoside, methyl α-d-glucoside, N-acetylglucosamine, amygdaline, cellobiose, d-melibiose, trehalose, melezitose, raffinose, glycogen, gentiobiose, d-turanose, d-fucose, potassium gluconate and potassium 2-ketogluconate.
Utilizes rhamnose, l-arabinose, d-glucose, d-fructose, d-mannitol, sorbitol, trehalose, but not benzoate, inositol as sole carbon sources.
Utilizes serine, l-proline, ornithine and arginine, but not glycine, l-aspartate, tryptophan, and phenylalanine as sole nitrogen sources.
Resistant to midecamycin (15 μg), erythromycin (15 μg), sulfamethoxazole (300 μg) and clindamycin (2 μg).

Sensitive to gentamicin (10 μg), polymyxin B (300 IU), neomycin (30 μg), ceftazidime (30 μg), amoxicillin (10 μg), rifampin (5 μg), ciprofloxacin (5 μg), vancomycin (30 μg), penicillin G (10 IU), novobiocin (5 μg), kanamycin (30 μg), and cefotaxime (30 μg).
Strains contain bacteriochlorophyll a and carotenoid.
The major cellular fatty acids are C18:1ω7c, C16:0, C18:0 and 11-Methyl C18:1ω7c.
The predominant ubiquinone is Q-10.
The dominant polar lipids are PG, PC, ALs, PL and L.
The DNA G + C contents of genomic DNA of these isolates were 67.9–69.7 mol%.
id="par0070">The type strain, SL014B-28A2T (=LMG 26072T = CGMCC 1.9170T), was isolated from crude oil-polluted soil in Shengli Oilfield, China.
SL014B-80A1 isolated from the same site is a reference strain.
